title: What is the future of technology in education? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology will without a doubt keep on entering the classroom as the gradual move from print to computerized proceeds in all commercial ventures. It is significant that there are regularly solid political/monetary helpers for governments to put resources into innovation in the classroom. Firstly numerous governments are trying to put resources into the IT capacities of the workforce and bringing innovation into learning is restricted of doing this. Furthermore, putting resources into instruction is an unmistakable political vote champ, and for these two reasons, it is conceivable that interest in training can in a few cases proceed in severe financial times.   From an academic perspective, then again, innovation all alone is not the response to enhanced instruction measures. Innovation equipment, be it a tablet or intuitive showcase is just an apparatus. Use of innovation must be connected to particular learning results. The idea of the 'flipped classroom' is not new, but rather is one that is liable to wind up more regular in the coming years. Rather than educators being mechanized instructors, educators can be pilots of every student’s education.

Right now we have developed ourselves by using projectors in classroom and Many other schools are planning for virtual reality class (VR MODE). In the near future we might not need teachers (for teaching).We might have robots which explains and proceeds each and every session. Robots which I meant are not humanoid.They might be a small voice behind the screen moving all the slides and teaching students.
